qas.question: Who is said to be the builder of the labyrinth?
During what period was art's main theme the representation of motion in a specific movement?
These free-standing statues were sometimes rendered from immestone, bronze, ivory and terracotta but were usually made from what material?

context: The animistic idea as the representation of the imaginative reality, is sanctified in the Homeric poems and in Greek myths, in stories of the god Hephaestus (Phaistos) and the mythic <a0_0>Daedalus<a0_0/> (the builder of the labyrinth) that made images which moved of their own accord. This kind of art goes back to the <a1_0>Minoan period<a1_0/>, when its main theme was the representation of motion in a specific moment. These free-standing statues were usually <a2_0>marble<a2_0/>, but also the form rendered in limestone, bronze, ivory and terracotta.
